current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for a progressive consumption tax and to
			 reform the income tax, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in
			 terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the
			 reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision
			 of the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 101. Imposition of progressive consumption tax.
TITLE II—Individual and corporate tax reform
Sec. 201. Individual income tax rate reductions.
Sec. 203. Repeal of limitations relating to itemized deductions.
Sec. 204. Termination of separate treatment of capital gains.
Sec. 206. Establishment of progressive tax rebate.
Sec. 211. Corporate income tax rate reduction.
TITLE III—Refund of excess consumption tax revenue
Sec. 301. Refunds of excess consumption tax revenue.

text.#text: A tax is hereby imposed on every taxable supply.

Except as provided in paragraph (2), the amount of
				the tax shall be 10 percent of the taxable amount.

The
				amount of the tax shall be zero with respect to the provision of
			 any  
			 supply which is—

a supply of tangible personal property that is exported from the United States within 90 days after
			 the provider gives an invoice for the supply, or
a supply, other than a supply of tangible personal property—

which is provided to a recipient that is not in the United States when the supply is performed or
			 otherwise done, and
the use of which takes place outside of the United States.

For purposes of this chapter, the taxable amount for any
				taxable supply	for which money is the only consideration shall be
			 the
			 price

including all

			 provider) plus the amount of any money paid in

the customs value

if there is no
				such customs value, the fair market value (determined as if the
			 importer had
				sold the supply).

header.#text: Special rule for services for employer

Supplies made 
				in connection with the United States

text.#text: For purposes of this chapter—

The supply  of tangible property
				is made in connection with the United States if—

the property is delivered or made available to the recipient in  the United
			 States, or
the property is assembled in or removed from any location in the  United States.

The supply of real property is made in connection with the United States if  the real
			 property is located in the United States.

For purposes of this chapter, the supply of anything other than tangible property or real property
			 is made in
			 connection with the United States if—

header.#text: Services, intangible property, and other supplies

text.#text:
the supply is used, performed, or otherwise
			 done in the United States, or
the supply is provided through a trade or business in the United States.
An exempt supply shall not be subject to tax under this chapter.
For purposes of this chapter—

to which substantial renovations have not been made after the date of the enactment of this

header.#text: Special rule for members of the Armed Forces

text.#text:
The consumption tax refund amount for any eligible filer for any qualifying excess consumption tax
			 year shall be the product of—
the applicable amount, times
the applicable shares of the eligible filer.
The applicable amount for any qualifying excess revenue consumption tax year is an amount equal to—
the excess  described in subsection (b)(1), divided by
the total number of applicable shares of all eligible filers  for such year.
The number of applicable shares for any eligible filer	shall be the sum of—
1 (2 in the case of a joint return), plus

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) claimed on the eligible
			 filer's return  for the filer's qualifying rebate taxable  year.

text.#text: ½ of the number of qualifying children (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has determined
			 the consumption tax refund amount.

text.#text: Payments under subsection (a) shall be made as soon as practical after the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is

text.#text: The table of sections for

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 6433. Refunds of excess consumption tax revenue.

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to calendar years beginning after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
